title: Employee Service Officer Job at Lheon Consulting Limited
content:
Lheon Consulting Limited is a strategy development and talent consultancy company, devoted exclusively to career shaping and personal development activities.We work globally with professionals and experts in the financial sectors to offer resourceful training, assessment and recruitment services to financial and non-bank financial institutions through use of innovative technologies to achieve a perfect workplace.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Employee Service Officer
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
Onboarding:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Ensure all employee profiles are created, and fully onboarded on the company’s Employee Management Software. Also, ensure that all correct documents are fully uploaded.
	Ensure that appropriate offer letters are generated in line with the SLA with respective client


Employee Relationship Management:


	Maintain an up to date database of all employees
	Attend to all employees’ enquiries, calls, mails on loans, vacations, offer letters.
	Manage employees’ relations bothering on deployment, compensation, disciplinary action, conflict resolution and interpretation/application of policies and procedures.
	Plan and facilitate periodic village meetings with employees.
	Manage the official WhatsApp groups with proper engagement of staff.
	Conduct periodic feedback survey on the quality of the company’s service to outsourced employees.


Client Relationship Management:


	Manage clients’ audit enquiry, query, and periodic assessment.
	Prepare monthly/quarterly activity report of activities.


Performance Management:


	Conduct performance appraisals exercise for outsourced staff.
	Negotiate with clients on appraisal outcomes and rewards.
	Prepare training needs and schedule training for outsourced employees.


Payroll Processing:


	Ensure submission of accurate salary variations promptly every month
	Ensure reconciliation of monthly invoice information with payroll variation information and submit to Finance for invoicing to client.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree with 3 - 7 years of work experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talentspool@phillipsoutsourcing.net using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Assistant Secretary Job at TopHire Africa
content:
TopHire Africa is a timeless and innovative HR-Consulting Service provider that's geared towards delivering recruitment and training of qualitatively verified talent.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Secretary

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Assistant Company Secretarywith 10 - 12 years relevant experience to assist the Group Company Secretary in ensuring the efficient administration, legal framework of the Company and maintenance of best-in-class governance.
	Proven experience in at least one of our investment sectors: power, hospitality, oil and gas, or energy is an added advantage.


Responsibilities


	Support the Group Company Secretary in ensuring effective corporate
	governance practices and compliance with statutory and regulatory obligations across the Group and its subsidiaries.
	Coordinate and document Board, Board Committee, and General
	Meetings, including preparing meeting notices, collating and distributing board packs, attending meetings, recording high-quality minutes, and tracking follow-up actions.
	Maintain and routinely update statutory registers and the corporate compliance calendar, ensuring timely filings and alerts for key governance activities.
	Prepare and file statutory returns and disclosures with regulatory
	bodies such as the Corporate Affairs Commission (CAC), Securities and
	Exchange Commission (SEC), and Nigerian Exchange Group (NGX) in line with regulatory timelines.
	Assist in the end-to-end planning and execution of the Annual General
	Meeting (AGM), including preparation of the notice of meetingshareholder communications, and engagement with registrars andservice providers.
	Provide governance and administrative support in relation to Board and
	Committee evaluations, policy reviews, and implementation of Boarddecisions.
	Support the onboarding, induction, and continuous education odirectors, including the preparation of induction materials and trainingschedules.
	Conduct preliminary legal and regulatory research to supportsecretariat operations and advisory governance.
	Liaise with external counsel, registrars, and other service providers oncorporate governance and regulatory compliance matters.
	Support the management of governance documentation including
	Board resolutions, policy archives, charters, and corporate filings.
	Assist in the coordination and oversight of secretarial functions forsubsidiaries within the Transcorp Group to ensure standardization andalignment with group governance requirements.
	Supervise junior members of the Company Secretariat team andsupport


Competencies:


	Strong legal acumen with the ability to interpret and apply complex legislation, regulatory guidance
	Demonstrated ability to manage Board and Committee operations with discretion, professionalism, and high attention to detail.
	Excellent drafting, proofing, and communication skills, with a mastery of minute-taking, Board reports, and regulatory submissions.
	Proficient in the use of Board management software (e.g., Diligent,
	Board Effect) and document collaboration tools.
	Track record of engaging effectively with senior stakeholders including regulators, institutional shareholders, and Board members.
	Capable of designing, implementing, and monitoring governance frameworks and internal controls across a multi-subsidiary group.
	Strong project management skills with the ability to manage multiple high-stakes deliverables concurrently.
	Adept at risk identification and mitigation from a governance, reputational, and compliance perspective.


Salary
N700,000 Monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualifed candidate should send their CV to: tophireafrica@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Senior Human Resources Manager Job at SAO Group
content:
SAO Group is one of Africa’s leading Social Impact Investment and Advisory firm operating exclusively in the agriculture sector across Africa, particularly in Nigeria. We are seeking to create positive economic impact and long-term value for private investors from the project planning to commissioning stage executed by carefully selected experts specific to each project and business unit within the Group.

We are a firm with a national and global outlook that focuses on the strategic development of transformational projects that create a sustainable economic impact for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Position: Senior Human Resources Manager

Job Location: Abuja
Type of job: Full time

Description


	Are you ready to work with multi-disciplinary teams? Do you thrive in complex environments, leading high-performing teams to achieve ambitious goals?
	SAO Group is seeking a well experienced Head of Human Resources who will be a member of the Senior Management Team, and will be responsible for developing, defining coordinating all human resource functions within the organization.
	You will be responsible for developing policies and procedures pertinent to organizational culture and processes as well as supporting all members of staff in order to ensure they reach their potential within the group.


What You’ll Do


	Provide managerial and leadership responsibility to staff in alignment with the company’s business plan and overall strategic vision.
	Develop standard operating procedures and policy documents and ensure that all members of staff understand and adhere to these documents.
	Champion the development of a strong company culture.
	Provide advice and coaching to all members of staff on all employee-related concerns like performance management, employee development, policies etc.
	Continuously seek to enhance an engaging culture with the organization to improve employee experience.
	Develop a companywide performance review structure and feedback mechanism.
	Oversee all HR functions from recruitment up till retirement.
	Provide advisory services to the executive management on issues related to but not limited to members of staff.
	Analyze trends and data related to employees to proffer solutions, advise, training programs and increase retention.
	Other responsibilities that may be added based on business requirements.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Personnel Management, or any other related field
	Master’s Degree in Management, Administration or related other fields.
	Relevant 8 years of experience in human resource management, of which 5 years should be managerial.
	You have a strong ability to independently make well-informed decisions and maintain the highest level of confidentiality.
	Preferred professional certification in SPHR, CIPD, CIPM, SHRM-CP CORE SKILLS.


Why Join Us?


	At SAO Group, you’ll be at the forefront of influencing the future of impactful businesses across Africa.
	We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, a fast-paced and dynamic work environment, and the opportunity to make a real difference.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and Cover Letter to: info@saocap.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Motion / Asset Designer Job at Roqqu Nigeria Limited
content:
Roqqu Nigeria Limited is recruiting qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Motion / Asset Designer

Job Location: Ikota Villa, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role


	We are looking for a Motion/Asset Designer to join our development team and bring our digital experiences to life through engaging animations and motion graphics.
	Your work will enhance UI interactions, marketing content, and product visuals, making them more dynamic, intuitive, and impactful.


Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Design and create high-quality motion graphics, animations, and transitions for web and mobile interfaces.
	Collaborate with designers, developers, and product teams to integrate motion seamlessly into our digital experiences.
	Work on micro-interactions, loading animations, explainer videos, and other motion-based assets.
	Optimize animations for performance across various platforms and devices.
	Maintain consistency with brand guidelines while pushing creative boundaries.
	Experiment with new motion trends and bring fresh ideas to the team.


Requirements


	3+ years of experience in motion design, animation, or a similar role.
	Proficiency in tools like After Effects, Lottie, Figma, Cinema 4D or Blender
	Strong understanding of UI animations, motion principles, and user interaction patterns.
	Ability to work with developers to implement animations using tools like Lottie or GIF
	A portfolio showcasing creative motion work and its impact on user experience.
	Strong communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.
